item.title: Air Fryer Egg & Cheese Toast
item.description: Start your day with this quick and delicious Air Fryer Egg & Cheese Toast! It's crispy, satisfying, and perfect for busy mornings or brunch cravings.
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 10 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 5 minutes

â° Total Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 2

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 slices of bread
  • 2 large eggs
  • 2 slices of cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Butter or oil for greasing

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the air fryer to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
  2. Grease the air fryer basket with butter or oil.
  3. Place the slices of bread in the basket and crack an egg onto each slice.
  4. Top each egg with a slice of cheese and season with salt and pepper.
  5. Air fry for 5 minutes or until the egg is cooked to your liking.

item.title: High-Protein Chocolate Peanut Butter Pudding for Healthy Mornings
item.description: Transform your mornings with this indulgent yet healthy pudding! Packed with protein and rich flavors, it's a delightful way to start your day. Try it today for a nutritious boost!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 0 minutes

â° Total Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup chia seeds
  • 4 cups almond milk
  • 1/2 cup cocoa powder
  • 1/2 cup peanut butter
  • 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Pinch of salt

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, whisk together almond milk, cocoa powder, peanut butter, honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt until smooth.
  2. Add chia seeds and stir well to combine.
  3. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight until thickened.
  4. Stir again before serving and enjoy chilled.

item.title: Hearty Oatmeal Apple Breakfast Bake for Busy Mornings
item.description: Start your day right with this Oatmeal Apple Breakfast Bake, a nutritious and delicious dish that combines oats and apples. Perfect for busy mornings or cozy weekends.
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups rolled oats
  • 2 cups milk
  • 2 apples, diced
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1/4 cup butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 2 eggs

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C).
  2. In a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, milk, diced apples, brown sugar, melted butter, cinnamon, salt, vanilla extract, and eggs.
  3. Mix until well combined.
  4. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish.
  5. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown and set.
  6. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.
